description.narrative: Funds are provided to (1) the Education Joint Financing Arrangment which strengthens the capacity of the Palestinian Authority's Ministry of Education and Higher Education, improving access to and quality of education; (2) the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UN-OCHA) in the oPt to assist the Office's advocacy and reporting on the humanitarian situation; (3) the UN-OCHA Humanitarian Fund in the oPt which quickly and reactively allocates funds for unexpected emergencies or unforeseen events; (4) the Agence Francaise de Developpement for the Gaza solar energy project which will advance solar power generation for the North Gaza Emergency Sewage Treatment Plant; and (5) the Ireland Palestine Scholarship Programme which provides fellowships to up to 25 Palestinian students to pursue postgraduate study in Ireland.

This focus area addresses development and humanitarian issues, providing support to Palestine refugees, together with a particular focus on education, which is crucial to Palestine's long-term economic viability.
